goals__remit:
The Romanian Ornithological Society (SOR) is an independent non-governmental organization, founded in 
1990, that works for birds and nature and relies on subscriptions, donations and projects. 
Aims: SOR is the Romania's largest wildlife conservation charity aiming to conserve and study the wild bird 
species, their habitats and sites in Romania, increasing people's awareness regarding environmental 
sustainability, working for the protection of biodiversity and bird fauna. As the Romanian partner of BirdLife 
International, SOR carries out its policy and strategy towards a joint worldwide target: conservation of birds 
and their habitats. 
Since June 2003, SOR works with the Romanian Government to implement the Natura 2000 network in 
Romania. 
Activities: The activity of SOR focuses on the following issues: Important Bird Areas Programme, study and 
protection of rare and endangered bird species; studies on bird migration; monitoring of specific bird 
species; distribution of breeding bird species of Romania; building action plans for the protection of bird 
species. SOR manages the national Important Bird Areas (IBA) programme in Romania since 1994. Since 
2010 SOR is custodian of 6 Natura 2000 areas and from 2016 the number of the SPAs managed by SOR 
raised to 17. 
Key activities include: 
a) Leading research on birds and their habitats; 
b) Developing and promoting policies to ensure a better future for the wildlife and the environment; 
c) Promoting solutions to decision makers to encourage environmental friendly management practices; 
d) Cooperating with non-governmental and governmental institutions to implement the Natura 2000 
network in Romania; 
e) Raising awareness, informing and involving 1000 members on conservation issues; 
f) Providing education and training; 
Structure: 
SOR has headquarter in Bucharest and two regional offices in Cluj-Napoca and Tulcea. National coverage 
through 19 branches and two school groups. 24 full time employees.
